reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Royal Society - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UKâ€™s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

title.narrative: Newton Mobility Grants (Year 1 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to strengthen emerging collaboration and to build networks to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Strengthen research capacity of the partner countries - by facilitating training and skill transfer from the UK to partner countries. â€¢ Support excellent research - by linking the best researchers in the UK with the best researchers and their groups in partner countries and providing support for initial exploratory research. â€¢ Establish long term research links - between both partners to ensure sustainable research capacity in partner countries and benefit to the UK research community in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 24 mobility grants at Â£12K each up to 2 years in duration over 3 years
Applicants may request: â—¾up to Â£3,000 for one-off travel lasting up to 3 months â—¾up to Â£6,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 1 year (including a maximum of Â£1,000 for research expenses) â—¾up to Â£12,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 2 years (including a maximum of Â£2,000 for research expenses)

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowships (Year 1 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to establish collaborative partnerships with UK researchers to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Support the development of a well - trained research community who by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge will create increased economic benefits and lead to changes in the wellbeing of communities. â€¢ Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. â€¢ Establish long-term links between the best research groups (and networks) in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 20 Fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships). Newton Advanced Fellowships are up to Â£74K each for up to 2 years in duration over 3 years

The aims are to: â€¢ Support the development of a well - trained research community who by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge will create increased economic benefits and lead to changes in the wellbeing of communities. â€¢ Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. â€¢ Establish long-term links between the best research groups (and networks) in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 18 Fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships). Newton Advanced Fellowships are up to Â£111K for up to 3 years in duration over 3 years

title.narrative: Newton Mobility Grants (Year 1 Round 2)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to strengthen emerging collaboration and to build networks to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Strengthen research capacity of the partner countries - by facilitating training and skill transfer from the UK to partner countries. â€¢ Support excellent research - by linking the best researchers in the UK with the best researchers and their groups in partner countries and providing support for initial exploratory research. â€¢ Establish long term research links - between both partners to ensure sustainable research capacity in partner countries and benefit to the UK research community in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 24 mobility grants at Â£12K each up to 2 years in duration over 3 years
Applicants may request: â—¾up to Â£3,000 for one-off travel lasting up to 3 months â—¾up to Â£6,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 1 year (including a maximum of Â£1,000 for research expenses) â—¾up to Â£12,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 2 years (including a maximum of Â£2,000 for research expenses)

title.narrative: Newton Mobility Grants (Year 2 Round 2)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to strengthen emerging collaboration and to build networks to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Strengthen research capacity of the partner countries - by facilitating training and skill transfer from the UK to partner countries. â€¢ Support excellent research - by linking the best researchers in the UK with the best researchers and their groups in partner countries and providing support for initial exploratory research. â€¢ Establish long term research links - between both partners to ensure sustainable research capacity in partner countries and benefit to the UK research community in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 24 mobility grants at Â£12K each up to 2 years in duration over 3 years
Applicants may request: â—¾up to Â£3,000 for one-off travel lasting up to 3 months â—¾up to Â£6,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 1 year (including a maximum of Â£1,000 for research expenses) â—¾up to Â£12,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 2 years (including a maximum of Â£2,000 for research expenses)

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowships (Year 2 Round 2)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to establish collaborative partnerships with UK researchers to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Support the development of a well - trained research community who by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge will create increased economic benefits and lead to changes in the wellbeing of communities. â€¢ Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. â€¢ Establish long-term links between the best research groups (and networks) in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 9 Fellowships at up to Â£74K each for up to 2 years in duration over 3 years

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowships (Year 3 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to establish collaborative partnerships with UK researchers to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Support the development of a well - trained research community who by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge will create increased economic benefits and lead to changes in the wellbeing of communities. â€¢ Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. â€¢ Establish long-term links between the best research groups (and networks) in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 17 Fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships). Newton Advanced Fellowships are up to Â£111K for up to 3 years in duration over 5 years

title.narrative: Newton Mobility Grants (Year 3 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to strengthen emerging collaboration and to build networks to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Strengthen research capacity of the partner countries - by facilitating training and skill transfer from the UK to partner countries. â€¢ Support excellent research - by linking the best researchers in the UK with the best researchers and their groups in partner countries and providing support for initial exploratory research. â€¢ Establish long term research links - between both partners to ensure sustainable research capacity in partner countries and benefit to the UK research community in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 24 mobility grants at Â£12K each up to 2 years in duration over 3 years
Applicants may request: â—¾up to Â£3,000 for one-off travel lasting up to 3 months â—¾up to Â£6,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 1 year (including a maximum of Â£1,000 for research expenses) â—¾up to Â£12,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 2 years (including a maximum of Â£2,000 for research expenses)

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowships (Year 4 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to establish collaborative partnerships with UK researchers to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Support the development of a well - trained research community who by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge will create increased economic benefits and lead to changes in the wellbeing of communities. â€¢ Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. â€¢ Establish long-term links between the best research groups (and networks) in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 17 Fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships). Newton Advanced Fellowships are up to Â£111K for up to 3 years in duration over 5 years

title.narrative: Newton Mobility Grants (Year 4 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to strengthen emerging collaboration and to build networks to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Strengthen research capacity of the partner countries - by facilitating training and skill transfer from the UK to partner countries. â€¢ Support excellent research - by linking the best researchers in the UK with the best researchers and their groups in partner countries and providing support for initial exploratory research. â€¢ Establish long term research links - between both partners to ensure sustainable research capacity in partner countries and benefit to the UK research community in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 24 mobility grants at Â£12K each up to 2 years in duration over 3 years
Applicants may request: â—¾up to Â£3,000 for one-off travel lasting up to 3 months â—¾up to Â£6,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 1 year (including a maximum of Â£1,000 for research expenses) â—¾up to Â£12,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 2 years (including a maximum of Â£2,000 for research expenses)

The aims are to: â€¢ Support the development of a well - trained research community who by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge will create increased economic benefits and lead to changes in the wellbeing of communities. â€¢ Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. â€¢ Establish long-term links between the best research groups (and networks) in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 20 Fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships). Newton Advanced Fellowships are up to Â£74K each for up to 2 years in duration over 3 years

The aims are to: â€¢ Strengthen research capacity of the partner countries - by facilitating training and skill transfer from the UK to partner countries. â€¢ Support excellent research - by linking the best researchers in the UK with the best researchers and their groups in partner countries and providing support for initial exploratory research. â€¢ Establish long term research links - between both partners to ensure sustainable research capacity in partner countries and benefit to the UK research community in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 24 mobility grants at Â£12K each up to 2 years in duration over 3 years
Applicants may request: â—¾up to Â£3,000 for one-off travel lasting up to 3 months â—¾up to Â£6,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 1 year (including a maximum of Â£1,000 for research expenses) â—¾up to Â£12,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 2 years (including a maximum of Â£2,000 for research expenses)

title.narrative: Newton Mobility Grants (Year 6 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to strengthen emerging collaboration and to build networks to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Strengthen research capacity of the partner countries - by facilitating training and skill transfer from the UK to partner countries. â€¢ Support excellent research - by linking the best researchers in the UK with the best researchers and their groups in partner countries and providing support for initial exploratory research. â€¢ Establish long term research links - between both partners to ensure sustainable research capacity in partner countries and benefit to the UK research community in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 24 mobility grants at Â£12K each up to 2 years in duration over 3 years
Applicants may request: â—¾up to Â£3,000 for one-off travel lasting up to 3 months â—¾up to Â£6,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 1 year (including a maximum of Â£1,000 for research expenses) â—¾up to Â£12,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 2 years (including a maximum of Â£2,000 for research expenses)

title.narrative: Newton Advanced Fellowships (Year 7 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to establish collaborative partnerships with UK researchers to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Support the development of a well - trained research community who by transferring new skills and creating new knowledge will create increased economic benefits and lead to changes in the wellbeing of communities. â€¢ Strengthen research excellence in partner countries by supporting promising independent, early-career researchers and their research groups and networks to develop their research through training, collaboration, reciprocal visits and the transfer of knowledge and skills from the UK. â€¢ Establish long-term links between the best research groups (and networks) in partner countries and the UK to ensure that improvements in research capacity are sustainable in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 12 Fellowships (Newton Advanced Fellowships/Newton International Fellowships). Newton Advanced Fellowships are up to Â£111K for up to 3 years in duration over 5 years

title.narrative: Newton Mobility Grants (Year 7 Round 1)

description.narrative: Support for international researchers to strengthen emerging collaboration and to build networks to facilitate training and skill transfer

The aims are to: â€¢ Strengthen research capacity of the partner countries - by facilitating training and skill transfer from the UK to partner countries. â€¢ Support excellent research - by linking the best researchers in the UK with the best researchers and their groups in partner countries and providing support for initial exploratory research. â€¢ Establish long term research links - between both partners to ensure sustainable research capacity in partner countries and benefit to the UK research community in the longer term. â€¢ Up to 24 mobility grants at Â£12K each up to 2 years in duration over 3 years
Applicants may request: â—¾up to Â£3,000 for one-off travel lasting up to 3 months â—¾up to Â£6,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 1 year (including a maximum of Â£1,000 for research expenses) â—¾up to Â£12,000 for multiple visits to be completed within 2 years (including a maximum of Â£2,000 for research expenses)
